sentences.en: A 15-year lifespan is not uncommon for a dog.
sentences.cn: 15年的寿命对狗而言是比较常见的。

sentences.en: Andrew went rigid when he saw a dog, any dog, anywhere.
sentences.cn: 安德鲁过去只要看见狗，无论在哪里，无论什么狗，都会吓得一动不动。

sentences.en: Any dog bite, no matter how small, needs immediate medical attention.
sentences.cn: 被狗咬后，不管伤口多小，都必须立即就医。

sentences.en: As soon as he got inside, the dog shook himself.
sentences.cn: 他一进来，狗就开始摇头摆尾。

sentences.en: he &B{led} poor Amy &B{a dog's life}.
sentences.cn: 他让可怜的艾米过着不幸的生活。

sentences.en: He could hear her dog barking and whining in the background.
sentences.cn: 他能听见她的狗在暗处吠叫、哀嚎。

sentences.en: He let down the tailgate so the dog could jump out.
sentences.cn: 他放下后背门，好让狗跳出来。

sentences.en: He picked the dog up by the scruff of the neck.
sentences.cn: 他一把抓住狗的脖子把它拎起来。

sentences.en: He’s taken the dog for a walk .
sentences.cn: 他去遛狗了。

sentences.en: I could hear a dog barking .
sentences.cn: 我听到了狗吠声。

sentences.en: Magistrates ordered his dog Samson to be put down immediately.
sentences.cn: 治安官们勒令立即将他的狗萨姆森杀掉。

sentences.en: New York is a dog-eat-dog society.
sentences.cn: 纽约是一个人吃人的社会。

sentences.en: Politicians want a lap-dog press which will uncritically report their propaganda.
sentences.cn: 政客们想要的是不问是非、甘为他们搞宣传的哈巴狗一样的新闻媒体。

sentences.en: the best I've seen in a dog's age.
sentences.cn: 很久以来我所见到的最好的。

sentences.en: The dog gazed at us lugubriously for a few minutes.
sentences.cn: 那只狗阴郁地盯着我们看了几分钟。

sentences.en: The dog's ears flattened slightly as Cook spoke his name.
sentences.cn: 库克叫这只狗的名字时，它的耳朵就会稍稍耷拉一下。

sentences.en: the most popular breed of dog
sentences.cn: 最受人喜欢的犬种

sentences.en: The policeman smiled at her. "Pretty dog."— "Oh well, thank you."
sentences.cn: 警察冲她笑了笑，“这狗真漂亮。”——“哦，谢谢。”

sentences.en: The whole place was a bit of a dog's dinner, really.
sentences.cn: 整个地方乌烟瘴气的，真的。

sentences.en: This is an ineffective method of controlling your dog.
sentences.cn: 用这种方法控制你的狗不起作用。

sentences.en: we &B{made a} real &B{dog's breakfast of it}.
sentences.cn: 我们把这事弄得真够糟的。

sentences.en: We used to have a dog when I was young.
sentences.cn: 我小时候我们养过狗。

sentences.en: You left the latch off the gate and the dog escaped.
sentences.cn: 你没把门闩插上，所以狗跑了。

words.tran_cn: 像狗的；时髦的；装阔气的

phrases.tran_cn: (英，非正式)干得很差的工作；一团糟
（充满问题和不公正待遇的）不愉快的生活
人吃人（指残酷无情的竞争）
狗食；一文不值，分文不值
占马槽的狗；占着茅坑不拉屎
[美国口语] 我可赌咒；见鬼
(北美)精心安排的盛大演出（或展示）

phrases.phrase: dogs bark, but the caravans move on
phrases.tran_cn: (谚)狗虽叫，商队还是会继续前进；说者自说，我行我素
(英，非正式)可笑地穿着时髦（或显摆）的衣服

phrases.phrase: every dog has his (或 its) day
give a dog a bad name and hang him
phrases.tran_cn: (谚)欲加之罪，何患无辞；流言可畏
[口语]莫惹是非，别惹麻烦，不自找麻烦；别多事[亦作 don't wake a sleeping dog]

trans.tran_cn: 狗，蹩脚货，丑女人，卑鄙小人
trans.tran_en: a common animal with four legs, fur, and a tail. Dogs are kept as pets or trained to guard places, find drugs etc.
a common animal with four legs, fur, and a tail. Dogs are kept as pets or trained to guard places, find drugs etc.
